Member Function Documentation

virtual std::string OR1DHistoHistogramsDecoder::GetDataObjectPath (  )  [inline, virtual]

Every decoder must overload this to return a path in the xml header.

For example, if the dataId is located under 

          <key>dataDescription</key>
          <dict>
          ...
              <key>AnObject</key>
              <dict>
              ...
                  <key>DataFromObject</key>
                  <dict>
                      <key>dataId</key>
                      <integer>9909</integer>
      
          ...
then GetDataObjectPath() would return "AnObject:DataFromObject". It automatically searches in the dataDescription dictionary and automatically adds the dataId key.

Implements ORVDataDecoder.

Definition at line 19 of file OR1DHistoHistogramsDecoder.hh.

void OR1DHistoHistogramsDecoder::Swap ( UInt_t *  dataRecord  )  [virtual]

Handles swapping of record.

ORVDataDecoder::Swap() is called when data not matching the endianness of the host machine comes in. By default, Swap() swaps all of the long words. If this is not needed, or something different is needed, please overload it in a derived decoder. Swap does (and should) not touch the first long word since this is already handled in ORVReader.

Reimplemented from ORVDataDecoder.
